page.title: 19ATTITUDES IN BICESTER
page.content: The inhabitants of Bicester are happy with the shopping facilities available, although more clothing shops are needed. The general consensus is that the too many pubs and not enough coffee bars etc. for young people to meet. A theatre and a cinema were also suggested as necessary entertainment. The old cinema was converted into a Bingo Hall some years ago. Some of the roads need widening,e.g. The Causway, which is a bottleneck for traffic.A passenger train link with Oxford is needed too. many arteas are difficult for the disabled to gain access to,e.g. the steps at the Post Office. A large number of pavements are too narrow to accommodate a wheelchair easily.
